titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Ann Elizabeth Taylor (1884-1972) was the Secretary of Missionary Support and Women's Work for the Board of National Missions. Taylor graduated from Macalester College in 1910 and was a trustee of the college (possibly the first woman to serve in this position). She was an active member of the Madison Avenue Church while she lived in New York City. When she retired she moved to Austin, Texas.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a scrapbook of the National Council of Women's Organizations of the Presbyterian Church (PCUSA), Inez (Mrs. Paul) Moser, Chair. The scrapbook contains photographs, printed materials, postcards, several reports, form correspondence and handouts, some ribbons and buttons, and newspaper clippings.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
